subject: Tyrion in Pewter
event: Here's something cool: the new miniature of Tyrion Lannister, soon to be rolling out from Dark Sword Miniatures. The mini hasn't been released yet. This is a prototype, painted by the amazing Jen Haley in a color scheme to match her gorgeous versions of Jaime and Cersei, which can be seen below. You can order your own Dark Sword miniatures at http://darkswordminiatures.com/ And Jen has her own website at http://www.paintrix-miniatures.com/ where you can see a lot more of astonishing brushwork. She takes commissions, too. Comments welcome, but only about miniatures, painting, and Tyrion. Please stay on topic.

comments.upictitle: An Internet person, on the Internet: <3!
comments.article:
Am I the only one that finds a 'miniature' of Tyrion a little ironic, seeing as how he's a miniature anyway?

:P

comments.upictitle: i'm yr here i am: [calvin] i'm significant
comments.article: I was just thinking that, actually :D Ironic win.
I love how strongly this sculpt matches those of his siblings, especially his brother's. Quite a lot of character in the details - Ms. Haley's work did it full justice, I think
The Dark Sword miniatures are about the best I've ever seen - superb detail on them. I've just finished painting the twins myself, and you can see my Night's Watch steward in the icon.

Some more Dark Sword miniatures (plus a smattering of older, much less detailed Citadel ones), painted by yours truly:

http://philmophlegm.livejournal.com/92088.html

It may seem surprising, but painting good miniatures is much easier than painting mediocre ones. The more detail there is, the easier it is for the brush to go in the right place!

Wonderful! Is that by Tom Meier? The hands and folds of the tunic suggest yes to me, but not sure.

He has hose, though, I notice. You've remarked previously that you're not a fan of that particular aspect of the Middle Ages, yes? ;) Though the whole outfit looks terrific on the miniature.
I'm trying to picture Peter Dinklage wearing a blond wig with a page boy haircut.  It's not the most flattering look ever. :-)

The beard, for me, was always a large part of identification. The fact it was all sorts of mish-mashed colors cross-hatched and whatnot, further emphasizing his relative oddness... the lack in the bit of artwork there is extremely strange to me! Otherwise, it seems quite nice.
Both the sculpt and the paint jobs are phenomenal!  It's always nice to see such a complex character portrayed so well.
Absolutely brilliant! Looks just as I would have imagined!
I'm happy to see this is pre-nose job. :) It looks great!
I kind of aways pictured him as more distorted... maybe part of his ugliness is in his mind as created by his siblings.

This is a very inaccurate mini. For one thing he has a nose. Second, where is the goblet of wine in one hand, and a whore in the other? Or is that mini being saved for second generation?

Sorry....looks like you'll have to recast this one.
comments.subject: Whoa whoa whoa....

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: pic#124268277
comments.article: To be honest, I pictured him a bit differently, but it's still a gorgeous miniature.

Me, too!

:-)
i forget how Tyrion looked like?
I'll buy Tyrion in pewter just as soon as I see Tyrion again in print.
comments.subject: Tell you what:

comments.article:
I always pictured Tyrion as Gimli from the LotR films, despite Gimli being a redhead and all that.

Seeing him depicted as blonde always confuses me a bit.

Tyrion ain't Gimli.

He's also not Happy, Dopey, Sleepy, Bashful, Sneezy, or Doc.

He might be a little bit Grumpy.
comments.subject: Not Gimli

comments.article:
Oh my goodness, I love it.
So much better than I imagined him :D
I think it came out very well.  It's a lovely piece that manages to capture the nobility of Tyrion.  Thanks for showing us.

i went to the painter's website... and she does not have any of these three - not Tyrion, Cersei or Jaime - in her galleries, which made me sad. :(

maybe she has them somewhere else? she's a wonderful painter (i wish i could paint that well! or at least AFFORD her work lol)

comments.upictitle: J.A.C.K. Inc.  Super Secret Ninja Force: chiburi
comments.article: That is beautifully done.  The colors are so vivid.
Tyrion is my favorite character.  He's very real to me.  (So please show the guy a little tenderness before you chop off anything else on him.)  :D
For anyone interested in seeing Jen Haley's work in person she will be the Miniature Hobby Events Guest of Honor at Gen Con this year.
They do awesome work and that paint job is top notch. If I was running a Westeros RPG I would kill to have these figs in my game.
comments.subject: wow

comments.article:
Dear mr G.R.R.Martin,

I know this will sound stupid, but I just had to write you.
I have this request that will sound a bit strange, and I know you will not help me but I had to write you to calm down the spirits lurking in my soul. The spirits that keep me awake at night and keep my mind thinkig of this what I'm about to ask you.

So, the thing is that....I wuold really like to get in touch with David Benioff or Dan Weiss so If you could tell them that, or send me their emial or something I would be gratefull. (my email: winteriscoming@net.hr)

I know this is a silly request, and you will not be able to help me but I had to ask....to get it out of my mind.

Anyway thank you.
He looks amazing!  I can't wait to see Tyrion again.

I'm still hoping Dark Sword will tone down size on minis, they seem to top 30mm so are not compatable with other 28mm lines. Makes it tough to do armies.

I'm taking a Night's Watch Army to Historicon this year for the Hordes of Things Tournament. Ordered the Dark Swords and intended to use them for characters/color but they were too large so had to use converstions for everything. Now have Jon Snow (Hero), Lord Mormont (Knight), Spare Boot (Bow), Sam Tarly (Bow) and of course the men of the Watch.

Hope figures drift down in size - well Tyrion will have too so might be worth a look.

Tom Thomas
comments.subject: Miniatures
